279 Harvard St. (at Beacon St.) • 617-566-6660

We Recommend You Need Go No Further Than Our Staff Recommends.

flora and fauna, take our recommendations.

A sun-drenched ghost story. A network of twisting tales from the undisputed champion of the modern short story. Sonnet, song, and narrative exploring the lives and contributions of African American performers lost to history. A hero’s story, similarly almost-lost-to-history and no less lyrical, with satisfying flights of brutal hand-to-hand combat. Want to get strictly historical? Get swept up in the wake of a giant in his field as he strides through the ocean waves. Or experience a ground-breaking autobiographical novel where life becomes art. Get down in the dirt and up in the clouds with a pair of sparkling nature writing specimens. 
The next time you come in, take in the view from Booksmith’s tower of staff recommended books. 

Just a few more recommendations before we part ways: We only have a limited number of the Asuka Tada’s amazing book flora, so if you are heading down aisle three do yourself a favor and take a look. Fauna’s most enduring element, recreated with the most fleeting expressions of flora. And then pick up The Electric Pencil, the meticulous record of one artist’s dedication in the face of supreme mental and spiritual challenge. For more on that topic, check this story about Street Lit, a homeless literary organization flourishing in Austin, TX, and jot down a reminder to attend our next event (date not yet set) with Boston’s own version, The Pilgrim.

Have a great week, read a lot, and take care out there. I’ve already gotten a sunburn.

Thanks for reading,
Paul
currently reading H is For Hawk.
currently listening to Riceboy Sleeps.
